meanings.definition: To go around or along the edge of something
meanings.sent1: The cat skirted the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: She skirted around the busy market to reach her destination.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel skirted the tree trunk in a playful manner.
meanings.sent4: The river skirted the town, bringing life to its edges.
meanings.sent5: The child skirted the playground, exploring every corner.

meanings.sent1: The detective skirted the suspect in the crowded street.
meanings.sent2: He skirted the topic of his grades during the conversation.
meanings.sent3: The student skirted the difficult question by changing the subject.
meanings.sent4: She skirted the issue, not wanting to confront it directly.
meanings.sent5: The politician skirted the controversy by focusing on other matters.

meanings.definition: To provide a border or edge to something
meanings.sent1: The lace skirted the hem of the dress beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The fence skirted the garden, protecting it from animals.
meanings.sent3: The colorful flowers skirted the pathway, creating a lovely border.
meanings.sent4: The mountains skirted the horizon, creating a majestic view.
meanings.sent5: The ribbon skirted the gift box, adding a final touch.
